intro: Polygala glandulosopilosa, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to southern China. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are alternate and often have a glandular surface, contributing to its common name. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and the plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds.
